did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Photographs of various British military and political leaders, and miscellaneous scenes in Great Britain.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research

Access to audiovisual materials requires at least two weeks advance notice. Audiovisual materials include sound recordings, video recordings, and motion picture film. Hoover staff will determine whether use copies of the materials requested can be made available. Some materials may not be accessible even with advance notice. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], British Pictorial Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in Stanford University's online catalog.

did.unittitle: 1 print of General Miles C. Dempsey addressing troops during World War II.
1 print of King George VI with British officers.
2 prints of Sir Bernard L. Montgomery
1 print of Wdwin D. Morel, with a short commentary on the back by David Starr Jordan,
1 autographed print of Lord Louis Mountbatten
1 print of Lord Northcliffe, publisher of the London daily Mail and British Director of Propaganda in Enemy Countries,
1 print of Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh and Consort of Elisabeth II.
